channel.title: Client avg detect virus - help please
channel.description: whenever i download and extract a 718 client my AVG anti-virus detects a Java/CVE-2013-2465 virus in the file Class52_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.class, i've read around and know that it's not malicious, but is there anyway to make my avg see it as not malicious, so i can use it?

item.title: Client avg detect virus - help please
item.dc:creator: @djzone djzone
item.description:
@djzone wrote:

[quote=“arceus70, post:4, topic:545634”][quote author=me n u 4ever link=topic=664517.msg4442303#msg4442303 date=1407135105]
whenever i download and extract a 718 client my AVG anti-virus detects a Java/CVE-2013-2465 virus in the file Class52_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.class, i’ve read around and know that it’s not malicious, but is there anyway to make my avg see it as not malicious, so i can use it?
[/quote]

its a false positive… i have this too but to solve it, u just have to let it through

Options->Adv settings->exceptions-> locate the file->save->apply
done and it won’t detect it as a virus[/quote]

It’s not necessarily a false positive. It could be something malicious.

Make sure you look at the class and see what it does.

Read full topic
item.source: Client avg detect virus - help please

item.title: Client avg detect virus - help please
item.dc:creator: @arceus70 arceus70
item.description:
@arceus70 wrote:

me n u 4ever:

whenever i download and extract a 718 client my AVG anti-virus detects a Java/CVE-2013-2465 virus in the file Class52_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.class, i’ve read around and know that it’s not malicious, but is there anyway to make my avg see it as not malicious, so i can use it?

its a false positive… i have this too but to solve it, u just have to let it through

Options->Adv settings->exceptions-> locate the file->save->apply
done and it won’t detect it as a virus

Read full topic
item.source: Client avg detect virus - help please
